intro: Angraecopsis montana, commonly known as the mountain star orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are pollinated by specific moths, showcasing a fascinating example of co-evolution between plants and their pollinators. Angraecopsis montana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated by enthusiasts of rare and exotic plants.
